children.subject: Did you read the COE FAQ I linked? It speaks to double majors in COE.
what about for people trying to declare eecs as a double major?

Generally, I wouldn't use the P in the GPA for the CS minor. If you needed to include the letter grade in order to meet the 2.0 once you had finished all the classes for the CS minor, you could request an exception at that time.

<md>If I'm planning to take CS 61a P/NP next semester, would the letter grade be used while calculating the minimum GPA? Since it states on the website that the overall GPA (for the 7 courses needed for the minor) "must be at least 2.0," I wanted to make know if my grade in CS61a will still be used to calculate that GPA.</md>
Hopefully you were able to find the information since the deadline for COE was yesterday, but here are instructions: https://sis.berkeley.edu/change-grading-option.
I think I changed the grading option incorrectly because mine says EPN. Is there anything I can do about this now?
You did it right! EPN means Elected Pass/Not Pass since you chose to have it graded that way instead of that being the only option.
How do you pnp a technical class? There doesn't seem to be a form for CoE.

history.content:
The faculty have voted that students pursuing the EECS, EIS, or CS minors may take classes for P/NP during Spring 2020, Fall 2020, and Spring 2021.

Taking EECS, EIS, & CS minor classes for P/NP will still fulfill prerequisites for subsequent classes in EECS.

Contact eecs-advising@eecs.berkeley.edu or cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu with questions. 

Data Science Minor students-contact ds-advising@berkeley.edu. 

Contact your college with PNP limit questions.

  • L&S: https://lsadvising.berkeley.edu/appointments-advice/virtual-front-desk
  • COE: https://engineering.berkeley.edu/students/advising-counseling/ess-advising/
  • COE FAQ: https://engineering.berkeley.edu/students/undergraduate-guide/policies-procedures/faq-covid-19-impacts-on-2020-21-student-policies/
